bioghist.p: Eric Partridge (1894-1979) was a noted New Zealand-born lexicographer of the English language, particularly of its slang. He published a number of reference works, including A Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English and A Dictionary of Catch Phrases.

scopecontent.p: The correspondence consists of correspondence, manuscripts and other materials related to Eric Partridge and his work. Incoming and outgoing correspondence with Eileen M. Wrigglesworth discusses their meetings, goings-on in each of their households, and Partridge's work. Correspondence with Neda M. Westlake (of the University of Pennsylvania Library) relates to the University's purchase of books and manuscripts from Partridge. Other materials include manuscripts and typescripts of reviews, articles, and Christmas greetings written by Partridge; newspaper clippings of reviews; a memorial to Julian Franklyn and a privately published volume of poems by Franklyn; and a heavily annotated copy of A First Dictionary by Walter D. Wright.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Indiana: A. Brown manuscripts (include letters of Partridge, including some from Wrigglesworth to Partridge); University of Exeter: Papers of Eric Partridge and Paul Beale relating to English slang (MS 138).
